newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Unigestion 1996 profit soars on bank sale.
newsitem.headline: Unigestion 1996 profit soars on bank sale.

text.p: Unigestion Holding SA, the Geneva-based finance company, said 1996 net profit jumped to 41.7 million Swiss francs from 11.1 million, mainly due to profit from the sale of its banking unit to Republic National Bank of New York (Suisse) SA.
Unigestion said in a statement it had extraordinary gains of 35 million francs in 1996, up from 5.6 million the year before.
Unigestion sold its Banque Unigestion to RNB in May, 1996. RNB is part of Safra Republic Holdings SA, a holding company for five banks active in international private and commercial banking.
Unigestion's management will propose a three franc dividend, or 7.5 percent of the shares' nominal value of 40 francs, to the shareholders' meeting on May 30.
Unigestion's operating profit rose 17 percent to 7.5 million in 1996 and the balance sheet total amounted to 237.3 million.
